Homer: So a few people won't get a few letters, boo hoo! You know the kind of letters people write. ''Dear somebody you've never heard of, How is so-and-so? Blah-blah-blah-blah-blah-blah-blah. Yours truly, some bozo.'' Big loss.
speaker: On watering the mail to prevent a letter from being mailed

quote: Homer: I guess it wouldn't do any good to run 'cause you're a mail-lady and you know my name and address and everything, huh?
Postal Worker: That's right.
Homer: Well.. I'm still going to run. [runs away]
speaker: Homer is caught tampering with a mailbox

quote: Mr. Roman: First question. Have you slept with anyone famous?
Burns: Well, Countess von Zeppelin and I... [catches himself] What in blazes!
speaker: Burns hires a ghost writer

quote: Homer: [trying to disguise his voice] Hello, my name is Mr. Burns. I believe you have a letter for me.
Postal Clerk: Okay, Mr. Burns, uh, what's your first name?
Homer: [brief pause] I don't know. [outside on the steps of the post office] Great plan, Bart.
speaker: Trying to intercept a letter

quote: Lisa: Ooh, look, Maggie! What is that? Dodecahedron! Dodecahedron!
Homer: Lisa, I don't know what you're doing, but it's very strange, and your father is trying to worry.
speaker: Lisa shows Maggie some very peculiar flashcards

quote: Burns: Who are you?
Homer: [thinks] Don't tell him. Give him a fake name. [aloud] Homer Simpson. [thinks] D'oh!
speaker: Thinking fast on your feet

quote: I could crush him like an ant. But it would be too easy. No, revenge is a dish best served cold. I'll bide my time until... Oh, what the hell. I'll just crush him like an ant.
speaker: Burns plans his next move

quote: Bart: You always told me I was going to destroy the family. But I never believed it.
Lisa: That's okay, Bart. Nobody really believed it. We were just trying to scare you.
speaker: Bart destroys the family

quote: In closing, gentle reader, I'd like to thank you. 'What's that?' you say? Me thanking you? No, it's not a misprint, for you see, I enjoyed writing this book as much as you enjoyed reading it. The End.
speaker: Burns finishes his book

quote: Moe: [answers the phone] Moe's Tavern, where the elite meet to drink.
Bart: Uh, hello. Is Mike there? Last name, Rotch.

Moe: Hold on, I'll check. [calls] Mike Rotch! Mike Rotch! Hey, has anybody seen Mike Rotch lately? [snickers from the patrons] [to phone] Listen, you little puke. One of these days, I'm going to catch you, and I'm going to carve my name on your back with an ice pick.
speaker: Another phone prank

quote: Moe: What's the matter, Homer? You're not your normal effervescent self.
Homer: I got my problems, Moe. Give me another one.
Moe: Homer, hey. You should not drink to forget your problems.
Barney: Yeah. You should only drink to enhance your social skills. [belch]
speaker: But does it work?

quote: We'll get the Simpsons a present. An extravagant present. A mad, unthinkable, utterly impossible present! A frabulous, grabulous, zip-zoop-zabulous present!
speaker: Monty Burns meets Dr. Seuss?

quote: Burns: Hello, young fellow. I haven't forgotten you. Here.
Bart: Wow, a crowbar!
Lisa: It's to open the crate, stupid.
speaker: Burns gives the Simpsons a gift

quote: Maggie: [holds up an 'Aztec' flashcard]
Lisa: No, Maggie. Not Aztec, Olmec. [slowly] Ol-mec.
Maggie: [falls down]
speaker: Lisa tries to enlighten Maggie

quote: Homer: Save a guy's life, and what do you get? Nothing! Worse than nothing! Just a big scary rock.
Bart: Hey, man, don't bad-mouth the head.
Marge: Homer, it's the thought that counts. The moral of the story is a good deed is its own reward.
Bart: Hey, we <got> a reward. The head is cool.
Marge: Then... I guess the moral is no good deed goes unrewarded.
Homer: Wait a minute. If I hadn't written that nasty letter, we wouldn't've gotten anything.
Marge: Well... Then I guess the moral is the squeaky wheel gets the grease.
Lisa: Perhaps there is no moral to this story.
Homer: Exactly! Just a bunch of stuff that happened.
Marge: But it certainly was a memorable few days.
Homer: Amen to that! [laughter all around]
speaker: We don't need no steenkin' morals
